intro: Alchemilla microdonta, commonly known as lesser lady’s mantle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, silky hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their supposed healing properties. Alchemilla microdonta thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks.
